_header: Almighty God in Trinity / Inwardly I thank Thee
_description: An orison to the Trinity — four couplets

BLEge3245.First Lines: Al myhtti god in triniteInwardly I þank it the…
BLEge3245.Last Lines: …honour ioye and louyngBe to þy name withowtin eendyng
BLEge3245.Attributed Title: Here beginniþ a souereyn orysoun to seye to þe holy trinite wiþ deuociun
BLEge3245.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Gurney Series of Religious Lyrics.” 
             PMLA
         54 (1939): 369-90: 376.

Lincoln91.First Lines:
Almyghty god in triniteInwardly I thanke þeffor thy gud
                    ded þat þu me wroghteAnd with þi precyous blude me
                    boghte…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…Honour Ioye & louyngBe til þi name with owttyn
                    endyng
Lincoln91.Facsimiles:
Brewer,  Derek Stanley,  and  A. E. B. Owen.  
             “Introduction.” 
             The Thornton Manuscript (Lincoln Cathedral MS. 91).
         London: Scolar Press, 1975.
Lincoln91.Editions:
Perry,  George G.,
                        ed.  
             Religious Pieces in Prose and Verse from R. Thornton’s
                MS.
EETS
         o.s. 26 (1867); repr. 1973: 77.
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             Yorkshire Writers.
         2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96: 1.363-4.
Comper,  Frances M. M. 
             The Life of Richard Rolle, Together with an Edition of his English
                Lyrics.
         London: J. M. Dent, 1928, 1933; New York: E. P. Dutton, 1929: 293-4.

PULKane21.First Lines:
Almyhty goud in triniteIn þis world I thank itte
                    þe…
PULKane21.Last Lines:
…Honour and þeroi [sic] and lowfingbe to þi
                    name withouten endyng
PULKane21.Note: Written as prose; immediately followed by 3193.
PULKane21.Editions:
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “A Middle English Versified Prayer to the Trinity.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         66 (1951): 312-14: 314.
